6.m: But he was pierced for our transgressions; he was crushed for our iniquities; upon him was the chastisement that brought us peace, and with his wounds we are healed. - Isaiah 53:5 (ESV)

l.q: Who was prophesied about in Isaiah 53?
In verse 6, what is man's spiritual condition?
l.a: We have all gone astray and turned our own way. We do things that are contrary to God's will and displease God.

l.q: In verses 10-11, what would be the purpose of Christ's coming here on earth?
l.a: Jesus Christ will bear our iniquities and will satisfy God's wrath and many will be made right with God.

6.p: Lord God, the love that you have for us men is beyond measure. Who are we for you to care so much, that your only Son had to carry the weight of all our sins and to suffer in our place? Thank you so much for your amazing grace.
